Certainly, here is an updated summary of the Banff itinerary with vegetarian dinner suggestions included:

Day 1: June 14 - Arrive in Calgary and drive to Banff. Check into your accommodation and spend the rest of the day exploring the town and its shops and restaurants. For dinner in Banff, try The Nourish Bistro, which offers a variety of vegetarian and vegan options. Their menu includes dishes like vegan burgers, salads, and bowls, as well as gluten-free and raw options.

Day 2: June 15 - Visit Lake Louise and Lake Moraine - Start the day with a visit to Lake Louise, where you can rent a canoe or paddleboat and enjoy the crystal clear water. Take a short hike on the Lakeshore Trail, which is flat and easy for young children. In the afternoon, drive to nearby Lake Moraine, which is known for its turquoise water and stunning views. Take a stroll around the lake or rent a canoe to explore the water. For dinner, check out The Bison Restaurant & Terrace in Banff. They have a variety of vegetarian options, including a roasted vegetable gnocchi and a vegetarian sandwich with roasted vegetables and goat cheese. They also have a great outdoor patio with views of the mountains.

Day 3: June 16 - Johnston Canyon Hike - Take a family-friendly hike at Johnston Canyon, which features picturesque waterfalls and a suspension bridge. The trail is relatively flat and easy, and it's only about 2.5 km round trip to the Lower Falls, which is the perfect distance for young children. After the hike, have a picnic lunch by the falls. In the afternoon, head to the Banff Upper Hot Springs, a natural hot spring that's perfect for soaking and relaxing with your little one. For dinner, head to the Indian Curry House in Banff, which offers a variety of vegetarian Indian dishes. Their menu includes vegetarian curries, biryanis, and samosas, as well as gluten-free and vegan options.

Day 4: June 17 - Drive along the Icefields Parkway - Take a scenic drive along the Icefields Parkway and stop at the Athabasca Glacier, which is a huge glacier that stretches across the Canadian Rockies. Take a tour on a specially designed Ice Explorer or hike on a Glacier Skywalk. Afterward, visit the nearby Athabasca Falls, a natural wonder known for its powerful rushing waters. For dinner, check out The Iron Goat Pub & Grill in Canmore, which offers a variety of vegetarian options. Their menu includes dishes like a roasted vegetable flatbread, vegetarian chili, and a quinoa salad.

Day 5: June 18 - Yoho National Park - Take a day trip to Yoho National Park, which is just a short drive from Banff. Visit the stunning Emerald Lake, which is known for its bright green water and scenic views. Take a family-friendly hike around the lake or rent a canoe to explore the lake. In the afternoon, visit the nearby Natural Bridge, which is a unique rock formation that has been carved out by the Kicking Horse River. For dinner, try The Emerald Lake Lodge in Yoho National Park. They have a variety of vegetarian options, including a vegetable risotto and a quinoa and vegetable stir-fry. They also have a beautiful lakeside setting and outdoor patio.

Day 6: June 19 - Departure - Return your rental car and catch your flight back to San Jose from Calgary International Airport.

These are just a few suggestions, but there are many other vegetarian-friendly restaurants in the area to choose from. Be sure to check menus and make reservations in advance as some restaurants may have limited seating or require reservations.
